text: How do I iterate over the tuples of the items of two or more lists in Python?
Specifically, I have two lists of strings that I'd like to combine into a string where each line is the next two strings from the lists, separated by spaces:
I want a function combine_to_lines() that would return:
I admit I've already solved this problem, so I'm going to post the answer.
But perhaps someone else has a better one or sees a flaw in mine.
Update: I over-simplified my example above.
In my real-world problem the lines were formatted in a more complicated manner that required the tuples returned from zip() to be unpacked.
But kudos to mhawke for coming up to the simplest solution to this example.
